physical_appearance:This print shows a ferry supported by wooden planks set atop a bed of rocks. It is tilted at an angle
 and several individuals can be seen working beneath the hull of the vessel. Sampans are seen near the stern.

sgcool_label_text:These photographs were taken by Egbert Sheaf
 the Australian Trade Commissioner in Singapore
 several taken before and some of which were most likely taken when he was posted here between 1922-25. Sheaf conscientiously studied South-East Asia\u0027s ethnography and his scholarship was coupled with a passion for travel and adventure. His photographs cover various aspects of daily and cultural life such as weaving
 the rice agriculture and other rituals of Javanese and Malayan communities
 as explained and illustrated in the portfolios and albums.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: These photographs were taken by Egbert Sheaf, the Australian Trade Commissioner in Singapore, several taken before and some of which were most likely taken when he was posted here between 1922-25. Sheaf conscientiously studied South-East Asia's ethnography and his scholarship was coupled with a passion for travel and adventure. His photographs cover various aspects of daily and cultural life such as weaving, the rice agriculture and other rituals of Javanese and Malayan communities, as explained and illustrated in the portfolios and albums.
